text: At the wizard's command, the ground opens up to reveal a portal through which long-dead knights ride forth to do battle.
At the wizard's command, the ground opens up to reveal a portal through which long-dead knights ride forth to do battle.
Grasping hold of his foe, the wizard pours forth the decaying power of ages, desiccating flesh, armour and bone, and reducing his victim to dust in a single heartbeat.
Grasping hold of his foe, the wizard pours forth the decaying power of ages, desiccating flesh, armour and bone, and reducing his victim to dust in a single heartbeat.
The greatest practitioners of the dark arts can summon forth the most fearsome champions and creatures of undeath.
The greatest practitioners of the dark arts can summon forth the most fearsome champions and creatures of undeath.
The wizard tears the souls from his victims' bodies before breathing unlife into their sundered corpses.
The wizard draws tendrils of the Wind of Death into a dark fog that restores the undead and fills them with unholy vigour.
The wizard draws tendrils of the Wind of Death into a dark fog that restores the undead and fills them with unholy vigour.
Drawing forth the dark energy coursing across the land, the caster sends the tendrills of power seeping into the ground in search of long-dead bodies to answer his summons.
Drawing forth the dark energy coursing across the land, the caster sends the tendrills of power seeping into the ground in search of long-dead bodies to answer his summons.
The wizard binds the bones of predatory creatures with dark magic, causing them to rise from their animal graves.
The wizard binds the bones of predatory creatures with dark magic, causing them to rise from their animal graves.

According to all known laws of aviation, there is no way that a cat should be able to fly. It does not have wings to get its fat little body off the ground. The cat, of course, flies anyways. Because cats don't care what humans think is impossible.
Nagash's pressence in the Mortal Realm acts as a conduit, allowing him to reach into the Realm of Souls, retrieving the spirits of dead soldiers for binding and eternal service to his will.
At the wizard's command, the ground opens up to reveal a portal through which long-dead knights ride forth to do battle.
Grasping hold of his foe, the wizard pours forth the decaying power of ages, desiccating flesh, armour and bone, and reducing his victim to dust in a single heartbeat.
The wizard draws tendrils of the Wind of Death into a dark fog that restores the undead and fills them with unholy vigour.
The wizard binds the bones of predatory creatures with dark magic, causing them to rise from their animal graves.
The wizard tears the souls from his victims' bodies before breathing unlife into their sundered corpses.
A colossal orb of purple-edged darkness materialises - those who do not escape its crystalline touch are doomed for eternity!
Creatures of the dark beware, for the Mage casts a ball of pure light to banish enemies of White Wizardry.
The Wizard calls upon the beneficent Guardian of Light to protect his allies from harm.
The Wizard calls forth spectral winds that howl through the enemy ranks, tearing their souls from their bodies.
Bolts of Dark Magic leap from the casterâ€™s eyes, withering flesh and blackening the bone beneath.
Imbued with the essence of the God of Death, the Nehekharans' blades strike with supernatural force to harvest souls for Djaf.
A whirlwind of skulls tears across the battlefield, devouring all in its path in the Goddess of the Green Moon's bitter, vindictive name.
Few have the strength to break free once the Kraken has them within its horrid, betentacled grasp.
The cries from Krell's victims reinvigorate his deathly corpse in a perpetual cycle of suffering and pain.
Such is the aura of entropy that surrounds the armour that it has the power to decay the magic of enemy weapons in an instant.
Vlad motivates his devoted followers with his majestic presence; the Lord of Undeath is without peer.
Vlad motivates his devoted followers with his majestic presence; the Lord of Undeath is without peer.
An Unholy swarm obliterates all in its path.
Neferrata calls forth her handmaidens to swarm and envelop the target in a whirlwind of beauty and death.

As the first Vampire, Neferata does not need to feast on the blood to revel in its pleasures, but she still does so willingly, gracefully ripping apart her victims and dancing in the red clouds that spill forth.
This ancient staff imbues any sorceries Neferata wields with pain and torment, causing waves of crippling agony to pulse outwards.

This blade has seen the blood of countless victims who have been sacrificed on its edge, their screams echoing out whenever the blade is drawn. So much pain and anguish has twisted the obsidian dagger to a point that it has developed Vampiric powers of its own.
As daylight goes, the air is filled with clawing, gnawing, biting and flapping swarms, and the space between bats is yet more frenzied bats.
Unearths Endless Tomb, Tomb that contains seamlessly unlimited number of skeletons.
Endless tomb behind the scenes makes summon of summon work [HIDDEN]
Endless tomb behind the scenes makes summon of summon work [HIDDEN]
Tomb will spit another batch of skeletons.
Calls upon Black Pyramids vast energies to enact bombardment and annihilate anything in the area.
The living do not stay dead long and neither do the dead, contorting their way through unlife with improved vigour and purpose.
Friendly targets are filled with magical energy, making them even more aggressive!
At the Necromancer's command, his enemies feel the looming shadow of undeath fall across them, sapping their strength and endurance.
A mass of accursed necrotic power swirls around Nagash, fusing into the unstable bonds of the dead and strengthening them.
Nagash's armour is forged from an alloy of lead and meteoric iron, over the millennia the armour has fused itself with his body
Mortis is a huge magical sword that crackles with unearthly power. The blade was forged and enchanted by Nagash himself and no-one else may use it.
Staff of Power, an ancient artifact crafted by Nagash himself which thrums with the raw power of Dark Magic.
Infused with part of Nagash's own malicious spirit, The Crown of Nagash reinvigorates his very essence.
A choking dust cloud erupts from the wizard's fingertips, suffocating all in its path.
Forces of Necromancy, hear the request of your most-powerful master: flow through me according to my will!
The surprising ability to hold back death despite some seriously heavy oppositionâ€¦
The Dread Abyssals, known also as the Hounds of Usirian, are amongst the most legendary creatures within the Underworld.
The morghasts are rising, and they are the heralds of death.
This stuff does actual damage with self refreshing vortex  [HIDDEN]
Wildly swirling ghosts will tear apart any enemy they can reach.
This stuff does actual damage with self refreshing vortex  [HIDDEN]
Wildly swirling ghosts will tear apart any enemy they can reach.
The plague cart is the very symbol of the last journey, that which ends at the cemetery gates and it is Lord Virions task to guide them to their fated destination.

Marshlights are ethereal creatures taking the form of glowing lights or lanterns, they emit a compelling hypnotic effect by which they lead mesmerised individuals to their deaths and feed on their ebbing life-force.
As these spirits near closer to their own demise, they grow in fury and malice to make sure all beings that draw breath will breath their last.
Warpstone and undeath may go hand in hand, despite only one or none of them having hands. There are also... paws out there eager to acquire warpstone.
Cold long, taloned hands grasping aimlessly towards their warm-blooded victims with terrible inevitability.
Traitors, oath-breakers and accursed, all have been driven mad, evil, or both by their years of torment and their only outlet is you...
The place between life and death, malign spirits wait and possess the objects or beings around them, lying in a state of dormancy until a victim draws near.
The air in these ancient woods is heavy with death, dark magic seeps through twisted trees empowering its denizens.
Inside every creature there is a crab waiting to emerge.
For one that falls, two more grasp weapons again.
Who knows what dwells deep below Quintex? They know.
Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the winds from whence they came.
Azhag tries to understand the murmurs from the crown, "guilty feet, no... no rhythm, fool" Ahhh, Zog it!
Necromancers can awaken mortal remains to reinforce their Undead legions.
In the darkness they linger, starving, waiting for a meal to present itself.
There are some very good reason to be afraid of the dark.
The green flames lick through the fog, empowering the dead around them.
Ask not for whom the bell tolls, as it tolls for thee...
The smell and taste of blood intensifies the rage of these most brutal creatures â€“ driving them forward to rip, tear and devour.
Recently turned to vampirism these thralls find it difficult to control their innate thirst and hunger for blood.
As the necromantic energies that bind them start to wain, these ancient warriors steel themselves, gripping to every moment of unlife they have remaining.
Cursed energy from dark magic thousands of years old, flares in green flame and frozen fire, immolating the very souls of those it touches.
Lord over a foetid field of bones, his kingdom a dismal graveyard of a populace that died in infamy in a forgotten age of the world.
Kalledria strikes all the notes on her cursed harp, causing listeners to feel 100 years of anguish all at once.
Long melodic tune is being played, filled with pain and sorrow of Kalledria, causing all listeners to lose their minds.
